abstract: Environmental Protection Agency sends letter to Nevada Gov Brian Sandoval informing him that it plans to place abandoned copper mine on Superfund's National Priority List; state has opposed previous efforts to list site.
lead_paragraph: Neighbors of the mine, which has leaked toxic chemicals for decades, won a $19.5 million settlement in 2013 from companies they accused of covering up the contamination to drinking water wells.

headline.main: E.P.A. Is Moving to Designate Contaminated Nevada Copper Mine a Superfund Site
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Is Moving to Designate Contaminated Nevada Copper Mine a Superfund Site

snippet: Neighbors of the mine, which has leaked toxic chemicals for decades, won a $19.5 million settlement in 2013 from companies they accused of covering up the contamination to drinking water wells.
